intro: Palicourea botryocephala, commonly known as the clustered palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and has a woody stem with opposite leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
